author: nordbjerg
content: for eip-7742, am I reading correctly that `maximum_blob_count` can essentially be ignored as this is validated in the cl?

author: spencer_tb
content: also can the `target_blob_count` technically be 0? (assuming the CL sends this)

author: ralexstokes
content: iirc it is needed to calculate the base fee update

author: ralexstokes
content: it is validated by the CL so the EL knows it is correct, but is still needed for the EL to do some computation

author: ralexstokes
content: there's also an open PR to also include in the header as it may be necessary in optimistic sync

author: nordbjerg
content:
it's only used here: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-4844.md#execution-layer-validation

```py
assert blob_gas_used <= MAX_BLOB_GAS_PER_BLOCK
```

which is now in the CL?

author: ralexstokes
content: ah sorry it is there so the proposer knows the max it can include during payload construction <@350408667356463104>

author: ralexstokes
content: theoretically yes, but i think we can all assume it will be non-zero
